name: Multi-select gesture controls unresponsive on iPad Pro
description_html: Users cannot perform multi-select operations using standard iPad gestures in the document library. Two-finger tap and drag actions fail to initiate selection, forcing users to individually tap checkboxes instead of using native tablet interactions.

name: Annotation sidebar collapses unexpectedly during PDF scrolling
description_html: The PDF annotation sidebar randomly collapses while users scroll through documents, particularly on longer papers. This disrupts the annotation workflow and causes users to lose their place in the comment thread.

name: Bibliography style preview not updating in real-time
description_html: Changes to citation style settings do not immediately reflect in the bibliography preview panel. Users must refresh the entire page to see updated formatting, making it difficult to fine-tune reference styles efficiently.

name: Focus state persists incorrectly after modal dismissal
description_html: Keyboard focus remains trapped in the previous modal location after closing dialog windows, requiring users to tab multiple times to return to the main interface. This particularly impacts keyboard-only users and screen reader navigation.

name: Collaborative comment threads truncated on narrow viewports
description_html: Deep nested comment threads in collaborative review mode become illegible on mobile devices and narrow browser windows. Content is cut off without horizontal scroll options, preventing users from reading full discussion context.

name: Auto-save indicator position obscures formatting toolbar
description_html: The auto-save status indicator overlaps with formatting controls in the rich text editor when viewing on tablets. This prevents access to bold, italic, and other text formatting options until the save animation completes.

name: Custom folder color selections reset after browser refresh
description_html: User-defined folder colors in the project organization sidebar revert to default values after page reload. This disrupts personal organization systems and makes it difficult to maintain consistent visual project management.

name: Export dialog missing progress indicator during large dataset generation
description_html: Users have no visual feedback when exporting large citation collections (500+ references). The dialog remains static without indicating processing status, leading to uncertainty about whether the export is working. Multiple users have reported clicking the export button repeatedly, causing duplicate requests.

name: Tag autocomplete dropdown clips behind reference list on RTL languages
description_html: When using Arabic, Hebrew, or other RTL language interfaces, the tag suggestion dropdown menu renders incorrectly and becomes partially obscured by the main reference list container. This affects tag creation and selection functionality for users of RTL languages.

name: Floating action button covers abstract text on mobile viewports
description_html: The 'Add to Library' floating action button overlays and obscures the last paragraph of abstract text when viewing papers on mobile devices. This affects readability and forces users to awkwardly scroll to read complete abstracts.

name: Voice dictation input field loses focus after punctuation commands
description_html: When using voice dictation for note-taking, the input field loses focus after speaking punctuation commands (period, comma, etc.). Users must manually refocus the field to continue dictation, disrupting the natural flow of voice input.

name: Reference preview cards fail to display author highlights on Firefox
description_html: Author name highlighting in reference preview cards is not rendering correctly in Firefox browsers. The highlight spans are present in the DOM but the visual highlighting effect is missing, making it difficult to identify emphasized authors in the preview.

name: Batch DOI lookup modal doesn't preserve scroll position after validation errors
description_html: When validating a list of DOIs in the batch lookup modal, encountering an error resets the scroll position to the top. Users lose their place in long lists of DOIs and must manually scroll back to find and correct invalid entries.

name: Undo/redo stack clears unexpectedly during collaborative editing
description_html: Users report losing their undo/redo history while collaboratively editing shared notes. The action stack appears to clear when multiple users are editing simultaneously, preventing recovery of recent changes and causing frustration during group work.

name: Smart folder rule builder dropdown menus fail to scroll on Chrome OS
description_html: Users on Chrome OS devices cannot scroll through the complete list of options in smart folder rule builder dropdowns. The scroll functionality appears broken specifically on Chrome OS, preventing access to rules beyond the initially visible options.

name: Search filter chips disappear after applying advanced query parameters
description_html: Active filter chips in the advanced search interface vanish when users add complex boolean operators or date ranges. This prevents users from seeing their currently applied filters and makes it difficult to iteratively refine search results. Particularly impacts systematic review workflows where precise filter tracking is essential.

name: Keyboard navigation breaks in citation suggestion dropdown after text formatting
description_html: Users cannot navigate citation suggestions with arrow keys after applying bold or italic formatting to surrounding text. Tab navigation also fails, forcing mouse interaction. This significantly impacts keyboard-dependent users and slows down the citation workflow for power users who rely on keyboard shortcuts.

name: Bulk metadata editor grid cells misaligned after horizontal scrolling
description_html: Column headers and data cells become misaligned when horizontally scrolling in the bulk metadata editor, especially with custom fields enabled. This creates confusion when editing large datasets and increases the risk of incorrect metadata assignments.

name: PDF annotation layer renders beneath page content in split-screen mode
description_html: When using split-screen view for PDF comparison, annotations appear underneath the document content instead of overlaying it. This makes highlights, comments, and markup invisible to users, severely impacting collaborative review workflows.

name: Quick citation insertion popover clips through fixed header on scroll
description_html: The quick citation insertion popover menu breaks out of its containing element and renders through the fixed header when scrolling. This creates an unusable interface where citation options become partially hidden and unclickable, disrupting the writing flow.

name: Workspace sharing dialog lacks keyboard focus trap
description_html: The modal dialog for sharing workspace access does not properly trap keyboard focus, allowing users to tab into invisible background elements. This creates accessibility issues and confusion for keyboard users, particularly when managing large team permissions.

name: Timeline visualization controls unresponsive at 150% browser zoom
description_html: Users cannot interact with timeline visualization controls when browser zoom is set to 150% or higher. Slider handles become misaligned and click targets shift, preventing proper filtering of publication dates and research milestones. This particularly impacts users with visual impairments who require increased zoom levels.

name: Multi-select drag behavior inconsistent when crossing nested folder boundaries
description_html: When users attempt to drag multiple selected items across nested folder boundaries in the document tree, the selection highlight behavior becomes inconsistent. Items occasionally deselect or fail to move with the group, particularly when dragging from a deeply nested folder to a parent folder. This creates confusion and potential data organization errors for users managing large document collections.

name: Citation style preview not updating when switching between numbered and author-date formats
description_html: The real-time citation style preview panel fails to properly update when users switch between numbered and author-date citation formats. The preview continues showing the previous format's styling until the page is refreshed, leading to confusion about which citation style will actually be applied to the document.

name: Screen reader announces incorrect state for expandable abstract sections
description_html: Screen readers are announcing incorrect ARIA states for expandable abstract sections in search results. The expanded/collapsed state is not properly synchronized with the visual representation, causing confusion for visually impaired users trying to navigate through search results efficiently.

name: Inline figure placement controls become unresponsive after consecutive paragraph merges
description_html: The inline figure placement controls (float left/right/center) become unresponsive after users perform multiple consecutive paragraph merge operations. Users must refresh the editor to regain control over figure placement, disrupting their document formatting workflow.

name: Custom reference field validation tooltips persist after form submission
description_html: Validation tooltips for custom reference fields remain visible even after successful form submission, creating visual clutter and confusion about the validation state. The tooltips should automatically dismiss upon successful validation and form submission.

name: Bibliography style selector resets to default after applying template changes
description_html: When users apply template changes to their document, the bibliography style selector unexpectedly resets to the default style instead of maintaining the user's previous selection. This forces users to reselect their preferred citation style after each template modification.

name: Footnote anchor positioning shifts when toggling between editing modes
description_html: Footnote anchor positions incorrectly shift relative to their reference text when switching between visual and source editing modes. This causes confusion and potential citation errors as the footnote markers appear to be associated with different portions of text depending on the active editing mode.

name: Collaborative comment threads collapse spontaneously during active discussions
description_html: Comment threads in collaborative mode spontaneously collapse while users are actively participating in discussions. This occurs randomly during typing and forces users to repeatedly expand threads to continue their conversations, disrupting collaborative review workflows.

name: Mendeley import dialog freezes when handling large BibTeX files
description_html: When users attempt to import reference libraries containing more than 500 entries from Mendeley, the import progress dialog becomes unresponsive. The loading spinner continues but no progress is made. This affects researchers trying to migrate large publication collections, forcing them to split their imports into smaller batches.

name: Color contrast ratio insufficient in graph visualization legends
description_html: The automatically generated colors used in citation network visualization legends fail to meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards for contrast ratio. This makes it difficult for users with color vision deficiencies to distinguish between different citation relationship types in the network view.

name: Reference table column resizing breaks after enabling group-by functionality
description_html: Users are unable to resize columns in the reference management table after enabling the group-by feature. Attempting to drag column headers results in the entire group collapsing instead of adjusting column width. This limitation forces users to disable grouping just to modify their column layouts.

name: Text selection behavior inconsistent in split-screen PDF comparison mode
description_html: When using the split-screen mode to compare two versions of a manuscript, text selection behaves erratically. Selections sometimes jump between the left and right panels, making it impossible to copy specific sections from one version. This impacts users trying to track changes between document revisions.

name: Auto-complete suggestions disappear behind floating toolbar in abstract editor
description_html: The keyword auto-complete dropdown menu is being rendered beneath the floating formatting toolbar in the abstract editor. This makes it impossible for users to see or select suggested terms when the cursor position causes the toolbar to overlap with the suggestion list.

name: Table of contents panel fails to highlight current section during smooth scroll
description_html: The active section indicator in the table of contents navigation panel does not update properly during smooth scrolling through a document. The highlight either lags significantly behind the viewed content or jumps erratically between sections, making it difficult for users to track their position in long manuscripts.

name: Batch tag editor modal loses focus state after applying filters
description_html: Users lose keyboard focus within the batch tag editor modal whenever they apply or adjust tag filters. The focus returns to the main document instead of maintaining position within the modal, forcing users to click back into the editor to continue their tagging workflow.

name: Reference preview cards fail to display non-Latin character sets
description_html: Hovering over citations containing non-Latin characters (e.g., Chinese, Korean, or Cyrillic) results in preview cards that display empty or corrupted text. This prevents users from quickly verifying references written in these languages without opening the full reference details.

name: Keyboard shortcuts panel becomes unscrollable after search filter application
description_html: The keyboard shortcuts help panel becomes unscrollable when users apply search filters to find specific commands. This prevents users from accessing shortcuts beyond the visible viewport, particularly affecting power users who rely heavily on keyboard navigation. The issue occurs specifically after typing in the search box and affects both mouse wheel and keyboard navigation attempts.

name: Multi-monitor drag-and-drop functionality breaks for reference manager panels
description_html: Users attempting to drag references between monitors experience cursor desynchronization and dropped states. The reference card becomes detached from the cursor position when crossing monitor boundaries, and occasionally disappears entirely. This severely impacts researchers working with multiple screens to organize their reference libraries.

name: Annotation highlight colors reset to default when switching between dark and light themes
description_html: PDF annotation highlight colors are not properly preserved when users toggle between dark and light themes. Custom color selections revert to system defaults, causing confusion and requiring users to reconfigure their highlighting preferences repeatedly. This particularly affects users who frequently switch between theme modes during different times of day.

name: Document outline minimap renders incorrectly on high DPI displays
description_html: The document outline minimap feature displays blurred or pixelated content on displays with high DPI settings. Section headings and visual indicators appear distorted, making it difficult for users to navigate through long documents using the minimap. This affects primarily users with 4K and Retina displays.

name: Voice dictation input field fails to maintain cursor position during pause periods
description_html: When using voice dictation for note-taking, the cursor position randomly jumps to the start of the input field during natural speaking pauses. This disrupts the flow of dictation and causes text to be inserted at incorrect positions, particularly problematic for users who rely on voice input for accessibility reasons.

name: Bulk metadata editor grid loses column customizations after sorting operations
description_html: Custom column arrangements in the bulk metadata editor are not preserved when users sort the grid by different fields. Column widths, visibility settings, and custom orderings reset to default state after each sort operation, forcing users to repeatedly reconfigure their preferred layout while working with large datasets.

name: Citation preview modal freezes on large bibliography imports
description_html: When importing bibliography files containing more than 100 citations, the preview modal becomes unresponsive. Users report that the loading spinner continues indefinitely and the modal must be force-closed. This affects the ability to verify citation data before importing into research projects.

name: Markdown editor loses formatting when pasting tables with merged cells
description_html: The rich text editor incorrectly handles pasted content containing tables with merged cells from external sources. The table structure breaks, cells become misaligned, and some content disappears. This is particularly problematic for users trying to include complex research data tables in their notes.

name: Annotation sidebar fails to sync across multiple browser tabs
description_html: When users have the same document open in multiple tabs, annotations made in one tab are not immediately reflected in other tabs. This causes confusion and potential data loss when researchers are working across multiple views of the same paper.

name: Reference graph visualization crashes with circular citation networks
description_html: The interactive reference graph renderer becomes unstable and eventually crashes when displaying papers with circular citation networks (papers that cite each other). This prevents researchers from effectively analyzing citation relationships in their field of study.

name: LaTeX equation renderer misaligns inline mathematical expressions
description_html: Inline mathematical expressions rendered using the LaTeX equation editor are displaying with incorrect vertical alignment relative to the surrounding text. This creates visual inconsistency in technical documents and affects readability of mathematical content.

name: PDF thumbnail generation fails for documents over 50MB
description_html: Thumbnail generation process stalls when handling large PDF files exceeding 50MB. Users see blank preview boxes instead of document thumbnails. This affects document organization and visual recognition in the library view. Memory profiling indicates potential WebAssembly heap allocation issues during PDF.js rendering.

name: Search filter dropdown components not keyboard accessible
description_html: Advanced search filter dropdowns cannot be navigated using keyboard controls alone. Tab navigation skips filter options, and Enter key doesn't trigger selection. This creates accessibility compliance issues and impacts users relying on keyboard navigation or screen readers.

name: Collaborative note sections lose real-time updates after 30 minutes
description_html: WebSocket connections for collaborative editing terminate after 30 minutes of activity, requiring page refresh to resume real-time updates. Changes made by collaborators don't appear until manual refresh. Investigation shows potential memory leak in Socket.IO event listeners.

name: Citation style preview fails to update when switching reference formats
description_html: Dynamic preview of citation styles doesn't update when users switch between APA, MLA, and Chicago formats. React component responsible for citation rendering remains in stale state. Users must manually refresh to see format changes reflected.

name: Bulk tag assignment modal freezes on collections over 1000 papers
description_html: The tag assignment interface becomes unresponsive when attempting to modify tags for large paper collections. Performance profiling shows excessive DOM updates and unoptimized state management causing UI thread blocking. Users unable to organize large research libraries effectively.

name: Research timeline component fails to render events spanning multiple years
description_html: Visual timeline display breaks when rendering research events that span across multiple years. Date calculations produce incorrect positioning, and long-duration events overlap incorrectly. Timeline grid becomes misaligned with date markers for spans exceeding 12 months.

name: Export to Word document corrupts embedded reference metadata
description_html: When exporting research notes to .docx format, citation metadata and cross-references become corrupted. Bibliography entries lose their dynamic linking capabilities, and reference numbering sequences break. Investigation points to incompatible HTML-to-Word conversion handling of custom data attributes.

name: Author network visualization fails to load with custom SVG node icons
description_html: D3.js force-directed graph visualization breaks when attempting to use custom SVG icons for author nodes. Default circles render correctly, but custom icons cause layout algorithm failures and prevent proper force simulation. Network becomes unusable for analyzing co-authorship patterns.

name: PDF page thumbnail grid fails to maintain aspect ratios in list view
description_html: Thumbnails in the document list view are being stretched incorrectly, causing distortion of page previews. This occurs specifically when users switch between grid and list views. The aspect ratio calculation isn't accounting for the container constraints in list mode, leading to visual inconsistency and poor user experience when browsing through document collections.

name: Citation snippet preview tooltips remain visible after element deletion
description_html: When users delete a citation reference from their document, the associated preview tooltip doesn't get properly cleaned up from the DOM. These orphaned tooltips accumulate over time, causing memory leaks and visual artifacts when hovering over other citations. The cleanup function in the tooltip management system needs to properly handle deletion events.

name: Reading progress tracker desyncs on split-screen document comparison
description_html: The reading progress indicator becomes inaccurate when users enter split-screen mode to compare documents. The scroll position calculation fails to account for the modified viewport dimensions, resulting in incorrect progress tracking and jumps in the progress bar. This affects users trying to track their reading progress across multiple documents simultaneously.

name: Infinite scroll in search results triggers multiple concurrent API calls
description_html: The infinite scroll implementation in the search results view is making redundant API calls when users scroll quickly. This occurs because the scroll event handler isn't properly debounced, leading to multiple simultaneous requests for the same data pages. This causes unnecessary server load and can result in out-of-order rendering of results.

name: Reference sorting algorithm fails to handle author names with special characters
description_html: The client-side sorting function for reference lists isn't correctly handling author names containing diacritical marks or non-Latin characters. This results in incorrect alphabetical ordering and inconsistent positioning of references in the bibliography. The string comparison logic needs to be updated to properly handle Unicode characters and their collation.

name: Highlight color picker modal breaks keyboard focus trap
description_html: The color picker modal for PDF highlights doesn't maintain proper keyboard focus management. Users can tab out of the modal into the background content, violating accessibility standards and creating a confusing navigation experience. The focus trap needs to be fixed to ensure keyboard users can properly navigate the color selection interface.

name: Document outline panel fails to expand nested sections properly
description_html: The document outline navigation panel isn't correctly handling deeply nested section hierarchies. When users click to expand sections beyond three levels deep, the visual hierarchy becomes misaligned and some subsections become inaccessible. The recursive rendering logic needs to be updated to properly handle arbitrary depth levels.

name: Virtual scrolling performance degrades with large annotation datasets
description_html: The virtual scrolling implementation in the annotations panel becomes sluggish when dealing with documents containing over 500 annotations. The rendering optimization isn't effectively recycling DOM nodes, causing increased memory usage and jerky scrolling behavior. This significantly impacts the user experience when reviewing heavily annotated documents.

name: Document comparison view fails to synchronize scroll positions across panels
description_html: When using the side-by-side document comparison feature, scrolling one panel does not properly synchronize the position of the adjacent document. This breaks the parallel reading experience and makes it difficult to compare corresponding sections. Issue occurs consistently when documents have different zoom levels or when one document contains more annotations than the other.

name: Batch citation export modal freezes during MLA to APA conversion
description_html: The citation style conversion process in the batch export modal becomes unresponsive when converting more than 50 citations from MLA to APA format. The progress indicator stalls at 60% and the UI becomes unresponsive. Console shows memory allocation errors, suggesting inefficient handling of large citation datasets during format transformation.

name: Text selection highlight overlay misaligned after PDF rotation
description_html: Highlight overlays for text selections become misaligned when the PDF document is rotated. The highlight coordinates do not update correctly with the new rotation matrix, causing highlights to appear offset from the actual text. This affects both existing highlights and new selections made after rotation.

name: Annotation sidebar renders incomplete LaTeX equations in comment threads
description_html: LaTeX mathematical equations added to annotation comments fail to render completely in the sidebar thread view. While the main document preview shows equations correctly, the sidebar only displays partial rendering or raw LaTeX code. Issue appears specific to nested comment threads where equation complexity exceeds 3 lines.

name: Reference graph visualization fails to update on collaborative edits
description_html: The interactive reference network graph does not reflect real-time changes when multiple users are simultaneously editing citation connections. New edges and nodes added by collaborators only appear after a full page refresh, leading to inconsistent visualization states between users working on the same project.

name: Multi-monitor PDF view loses window position on workspace switch
description_html: When using the multi-monitor PDF viewing feature, window positions and sizes are not preserved when switching between different workspaces. Windows reset to default positions on the primary monitor, disrupting users' carefully arranged viewing layouts. This occurs specifically when the workspace contains more than 3 simultaneously open PDF documents.

name: Custom bibliography style editor fails to validate CSL syntax
description_html: The custom citation style editor accepts invalid CSL (Citation Style Language) syntax without warning, leading to broken citation formatting. The real-time preview doesn't catch malformed XML structures, and users only discover issues after applying the style to their bibliography. Validation feedback is needed during the editing process.

name: Table of contents generation fails for documents with nested appendices
description_html: The automatic table of contents generator fails to properly index and link to appendix sections when they contain nested subsections. The hierarchy becomes flattened, and clicking on TOC entries for nested appendix content either jumps to incorrect locations or fails to navigate at all. This affects particularly complex academic papers with multiple levels of supplementary materials.

name: Citation style preview widget crashes when switching between numeric and author-date formats
description_html: Users experience a complete widget crash when rapidly switching between numeric and author-date citation formats in the style preview panel. The issue appears to be related to incomplete cleanup of citation rendering components, requiring a page refresh to restore functionality.

name: Search filter chips disappear after applying multiple metadata-based filters
description_html: When users apply more than three metadata-based filters (e.g., publication year, journal, author) in the advanced search interface, some filter chips become invisible while still affecting the search results. The filters remain active but cannot be removed without clearing all filters.

name: Collaborative annotation markers stack incorrectly in multi-user sessions
description_html: When multiple users are simultaneously annotating the same document, annotation markers begin to stack incorrectly after the 15-minute mark, causing visual overlap and making it difficult to distinguish between different users' contributions. The issue persists until the document is reloaded.

name: Document version comparison slider fails to update minimap highlights
description_html: The minimap highlighting system in the version comparison view doesn't update when using the comparison slider, leading to misaligned change indicators. Users cannot effectively navigate between document versions using the minimap navigation.

name: Bibliography export dialog freezes during large dataset concatenation
description_html: When attempting to export bibliographies containing more than 500 references, the export dialog becomes unresponsive during the concatenation process. Users cannot cancel the operation or close the dialog, requiring a browser refresh to recover.

name: Reference management sidebar loses state after browser tab suspension
description_html: The reference management sidebar fails to properly restore its state when a browser tab is suspended and later reactivated. This results in lost filtering preferences and collapsed folder structures, disrupting user workflow in long research sessions.

name: Markdown editor toolbar becomes unresponsive after inserting multiple LaTeX blocks
description_html: The rich text editing toolbar stops responding to clicks after users insert 3+ LaTeX equation blocks into a notebook. Affects formatting controls and style dropdowns. Users must refresh the page to restore functionality, losing unsaved changes. High impact on researchers writing math-heavy notes.

name: Citation suggestions dropdown remains visible after switching workspaces
description_html: The citation autocomplete dropdown persists on screen when users switch between different research workspaces, showing suggestions from the previous context. Creates confusion and potential for incorrect citations. Requires manual DOM cleanup.

name: Bulk tag assignment modal freezes during keyword extraction
description_html: When applying automatic keyword extraction to tag multiple papers simultaneously, the UI becomes unresponsive. The processing should be moved to a background worker to prevent blocking the main thread. Currently affects batch operations on 20+ papers.

name: Reading progress tracker desyncs after offline mode synchronization
description_html: Reading progress indicators show incorrect values after users work offline and reconnect. The local storage conflict resolution fails to merge progress data properly, resulting in lost tracking information and duplicate reading sessions.

name: Cross-reference links break after collaborative note merging
description_html: Internal cross-references between research notes become invalid when multiple users merge collaborative changes. The unique identifiers for referenced sections are not properly updated in the conflict resolution process, leading to broken navigation.

name: Literature review canvas fails to auto-save node positions
description_html: The visual literature review canvas does not persistently store node positions after manual arrangement. When reopening the canvas, all papers revert to the default force-directed layout, losing careful manual organization of research relationships.

name: PDF viewer performance degradation with multiple annotation layers
description_html: PDF rendering becomes increasingly sluggish when multiple annotation layers are active simultaneously. Users report 2-3 second delays when toggling between annotation sets, particularly in documents exceeding 50 pages. Memory usage grows linearly with each additional layer, leading to potential browser crashes on lower-end devices.

name: Citation graph visualization fails to load with over 200 connected nodes
description_html: The interactive citation network visualization becomes unresponsive when attempting to display large connected paper networks. Browser console shows WebGL context errors, and users report blank screens when trying to explore citation relationships in large systematic reviews. Affects approximately 15% of users working with comprehensive literature reviews.

name: Reference suggestion popover misaligned in split-screen mode
description_html: The citation suggestion popover appears in incorrect positions when using split-screen editing mode. Position calculations fail to account for scroll offset in the secondary pane, causing suggestions to appear either partially off-screen or overlapping with content. Issue becomes more pronounced with multiple monitors with different scaling settings.

name: Batch metadata editor state corruption after network interruption
description_html: Users experience data loss when editing metadata for multiple papers simultaneously if their network connection is interrupted. The batch editor's state management fails to properly recover, sometimes applying partial changes incorrectly across the selection. Recovery mechanism needed to prevent inconsistent states.

name: Text highlight extraction fails with mixed RTL/LTR content
description_html: Highlighting and extracting quotes from PDFs containing mixed right-to-left and left-to-right text results in scrambled content in the notes panel. Character ordering becomes incorrect, and highlight bounds are miscalculated. Particularly affects papers with mixed English and Arabic/Hebrew mathematical notations.

name: Collaborative comment threads collapse unexpectedly during active discussions
description_html: During active multi-user commenting sessions, comment threads spontaneously collapse and expand, disrupting ongoing discussions. Real-time updates are not properly reconciling thread state between users, leading to lost context and confusion in collaborative review sessions. Users report having to frequently reload to see complete thread history.

name: Custom keyboard shortcuts stop responding after export operation
description_html: User-defined keyboard shortcuts become unresponsive after performing any document export operation (PDF, Word, or BibTeX). The keyboard event listeners appear to detach, requiring application restart to restore functionality. Affects all custom shortcuts while default shortcuts remain functional.

name: Citation preview tooltips fail to display for DOI links in dark mode
description_html: Citation preview tooltips are not rendering correctly when hovering over DOI links while using dark mode. The tooltip appears blank or shows incorrect background colors, making the citation text illegible. This affects all DOI preview interactions across the platform and impacts users' ability to quickly verify references without opening full citation views.

name: Infinite scroll pagination breaks after applying multiple tag filters
description_html: When users apply more than three tag filters to their literature list, the infinite scroll pagination mechanism stops functioning correctly. The loading indicator appears but new items never load, requiring a page refresh to continue browsing. This severely impacts users working with large, categorized literature collections.
